result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward L Femrite Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DA has 14 days to prepare/submit order.
Remitted.  VW surcharge due in 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.

records.addlTxt:
to change jail report date. 

Crt changes Def's jail report date from Jan 20,2017 to Feb 20,2017.

Defendant in court with Attorney Tracey J Lencioni.  Margaret Delain appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Edward L Femrite in court with attorney Tracey J Lencioni. Prosecuting Atty Margaret Delain appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defn. showed up in court with attorney and requested change of report date from 1-20-2017 to 2-20-2017. Ct. grants request and orders report date changed to 2-20-2017. Clerk contacts jail records to inform them of the change.  Clerk of courts to forward new J.O.C. to records/jail.  Amended Judgment of Conviction prepared.
DE's copy of Order for Restitution and payment info returned. Not deliverable as addressed. Unable to forward.

Trial Judge - Br 5

Defendant appeared.  Allison E. Cogbill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
